Hi Martin,

My favorite, largely because of the title, is: 

In silicon no =
one can hear you scream: Evolving fighting creatures. Miconi. 2008. 
http:/=
/f3.tiera.ru/2/Cs_Computer%20science/CsLn_Lecture%20notes/G/Genetic%20Progr=
amming,%2011%20conf.,%20EuroGP%202008(LNCS4971,%20Springer,%202008)(ISBN%20=
9783540786702)(384s).pdf#page=3D35


Best regards,
Jeff Clune

Assistant Pr=
ofessor
Computer Science
University of Wyoming
jeffclune@...
jeffclune=
.com

On May 8, 2014, at 8:12 AM, martin.pyka@... wrote:

> 
> Hi,
> =

> 
> 
> I am currently working on an open-ended evolution simulation that =
is a bit motivated by Tierra and the fighting robots of Sims. I also read t=
he paper by Turk about his sticky feet simulations. Which paper about an op=
en-ended evolution simulation  would you recommend me to read in order to r=
elate my work to those of others.
> 
> 
> 
> Thank you,
> 
> Martin
> 
> 
>=
 


--Apple-Mail=_9F7B794D-D472-46B5-BF03-435D1FE4AABA
